On Tue, 2003-07-15 at 15:22, Matthew Welch wrote:
This is something that has been bothering me almost to the point of my considering dropping Evolution as my email client, despite the fact that I need it to access an Exchange server.

Evolution's email component is certainly intended to have advanced text editing functionality, but there's one aspect of the text editor that is such a rookie mistake when it comes to text editing that I have to assume that I must have something misconfigured in my own environment. This oddity is the blinking cursor. If you take a look at at any given text editing environment (command line, word processor, etc.), you'll notice that the cursor, when not moving, blinks. However when it's moving, the blinking stops. The obvious reason for this is that if the cursor is blinking while it's moving, then for that half second or so when the cursor is not visible, you have no idea where it is. That's ok, when the cursor isn't moving because you know still know where the cursor will return, but it's BEYOND MADDENING when trying to move your cursor around text for the purpose of editing. I'm constantly over or under shooting where I'm trying to place the cursor.

I happen to be a pretty poor typist so I have to diligently proofread every email I send in the business environment. That means that I use ctrl-left and ctrl-right a ton to move the cursor around my text. The cursor disappearing while I'm doing this has just about driven me over the edge into insanity.
Please, PLEASE, someone tell me I have a setting wrong somewhere and that I can change to fix this. Other this this issue, I absolutely love Evolution but I'm almost at my tolerance limit.
